ygData.subject: finally done-- and question/survey
ygData.msgSnippet: When I first started-- I decided I wanted to read ALL the posts listed. I have now finished that quest. =) Course when one has to work at 6am and you answer
ygData.messageBody:
When I first started-- I decided I wanted to read
ALL the posts listed. I have now finished that quest.
=) Course when one has to work at 6am and you answer
like 2 calls in first two hours before it picks up--
One has a lot of time to read posts.<br><br>As far as
EQ-- still a lowly 4th lvl Druid. But having lotsa
fun. Helped a guild get formed yesterday. Hoping it
does well. It's a bunch of ppl from work. But it's
definately an interesting bunch. =)<br><br>One of it's
primary rules was "no twinking". I protested to that as I
was an advocate of twinking. There after-- I found
out that my definition of twinking is different than
guild's def. I guess everyone thinks of twinking as a
different thing.<br><br>I think of twinking as decking out
your new character or level 4 character with a magic
weapon (like a druid equivalent of 1h silvery axe would
be twinking to me). Or giving your character full
Banded/bronze (silk if you're a monk). Or giving your character
100 plat.<br><br>I'm curious what ppl define as
Twinking. Is what I defined here "twinking" to
others?<br><br>I'm asking b/c I couldn't see how skills would suffer
from this and now I see. I'm a big believer in upping
skills. I've also discovered from friends that my plan of
making money with the Monk is a bad plan. Which is why
I'm going back to druid. Following my GM's
instructions on the slow but sure way to gain money for
spells. And using my monk for future plans of a character
with Master levels of all trade skills. Grin.
=)<br><br>OK... I've rambled on enough.<br><br>shooman out...
<br><br>FatedHue- WE Druid<br><br>PS... feel free to comment on any
portion of post. The Twinking, the Monk's being bad at
earning money, the reading of posts-- heck even the PS if
ya want. Once more. I apologize for writing so much.
